Owlhawk:  As I said we use it for power.  Besides
igniting all the energon on this planet would result
in.....well let's just say a very big boom.

--- Nic <wingedwarrior41@...> wrote:
> Katya: So I assume there is a use to this energon if
> you do not 
> consider destroying it, quiaff?
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...>
> wrote:
> > Owlhawk:  As I already said we aquire these Beast
> > Modes based on the DNA of local animals to
> conteract
> > the radiation.  Also through experiences with an
> alien
> > race called the Vok, some bots like myself have
> become
> > transmetal.  Transmetals can be damaged by energon
> > radiation, but have a much higher tolerance for
> it. 
> > Here however the energon radiation seems to
> fluctuate
> > from nearly zero, to off the scale.  So much even
> a
> > transmetal can be damaged by it outside of Beast
> Mode.
> > 
> > --- Azure The Warrior <wingedwarrior41@h...>
> > wrote:
> > > Katya refrained to protest about the fact that
> her
> > > mech was by far better 
> > > then those made on Terra. It was irrelevant and
> she
> > > knew it. What bothered 
> > > her was the efficiency of Owlhawk considering
> these
> > > radiations.
> > > 
> > > Katya: Is there a mean to counteract the
> radiations?
> > > 
> > >

> > > >Reply-To: nbwrpg@y...

> stated.
> > > >
> > > >BIC:  Owlhawk:  It's that glowing stone I
> showed
> > > you
> > > >back at the base.  It's the reason we aquired
> Beast
> > > >Modes.  We use it for power, but to much of it
> can
> > > >cause damage in robot mode.  Earth is rich in
> it,
> > > and
> > > >has enormous amounts of radiation.  My guess is
> > > that
> > > >you're not affected by it because you're an
> > > organic,
> > > >and your suit is not affected by it, because it
> was
> > > >first developed here on Earth.
> > > >
